intro: Galium obtusum subsp. obtusum, commonly known as bluntleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a low-growing herb with opposite, oval to ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are often prostrate or ascending, and it has a fibrous root system that helps it anchor in soil.
